title: 'This is a state of emergency': Houses in Canada dragged out to sea by Fiona
description: Fiona touched down in Nova Scotia as a post-tropical cyclone with hurricane-strength winds that carried homes off their foundations and into the Atlantic.

title: Iranian Americans are demonstrating across the US in support of protesters in Iran
description: Iranian Americans are staging demonstrations across the United States this weekend in solidarity with ongoing protests in Iran over the death of a 22-year-old woman who collapsed while in custody of morality police.

title: Jazz saxophonist Pharoah Sanders dies at age 81
description: Jazz saxophonist Pharoah Sanders has died at the age of 81, according to an announcement Saturday by record label Luaka Bop and a statement from his representative.

title: New York buildings are blanketed with dead and twitching spotted lanternflies. The rest of the US could be next
People we've lost in 2022
description: Here are some of the most famous people who have died in 2022.

title: Police cruiser struck by train with woman inside
description: Colorado police released bodycam footage showing the moment a train hit a parked police car with a suspect inside. Authorities say the 20-year-old was left with serious injuries and is expected to survive.

title: John Cena breaks Make-A-Wish record after granting 650 wishes
description: Actor, wrestling legend, and perpetual meme subject John Cena has completed a new accomplishment: breaking the World Record for most wishes granted through the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

title: Queen Elizabeth's final resting place revealed in new photo
description: Buckingham Palace has released a photograph of Queen Elizabeth II's final resting place within St. George's Chapel following her interment in Windsor on Monday.

title: FIDE reprimands Magnus Carlsen for quitting match after one move but 'shares his deep concerns' about cheating in chess
description: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) reprimanded former world champion Magnus Carlsen for resigning from an online chess match against fellow grandmaster Hans Niemann after just one move but added that it shared the world No.1's "deep concerns about the damage that cheating brings to chess."

title: See the surprise that brought Elton John to tears at White House
description: President Joe Biden surprised Sir Elton John with the National Humanities Medal after a concert at the White House in honor of John's advocacy in the global fight against HIV/AIDS.

title: Oscar-winning actress Louise Fletcher dies at 88
description: Louise Fletcher, the actress who won an Academy Award for her role as Nurse Ratched in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest," died Friday at her home in Montdurausse, France, according to her agent David Shaul. She was 88.

title: Post-tropical cyclone Fiona slams Canada's Atlantic coast
Thought you paid a lot to heat your home last year? Wait until this winter
description: After noticing his electric bills rising earlier this year, Jason Bell opted to go on a budget plan so he could spread the cost over 12 months. He and his husband, Shane, figured that would help them get through the coming winter since their Lake Harmony, Pennsylvania, home is heated by electricity.

title: Reports of sea turtle poaching are on the decline, study says
description: A new study says that the risk poaching poses to endangered sea turtles is on the decline -- although data on the subject is scarce.

title: NASA waves off next Artemis I launch attempt due to tropical storm
description: The Artemis I rocket will not have its third launch attempt on Tuesday as planned due to concerns over Tropical Storm Ian making its way toward Cuba and Florida.

title: Post-tropical cyclone Fiona slams Canada's Atlantic coast
description:
• Fiona rips through Canada's eastern seaboard
• Meteorologist: Fiona could be Canada's Super Storm Sandy

title: Arsenal hammers Tottenham 4-0 as match at Women's Super League
description: In front of the largest-ever crowd for a Women's Super League match, Arsenal defeated its archrival Tottenham Hotspur 4-0 on a historic day for women's football in England.

title: The January 6 hearings must go on
description: On September 28,  Democratic Rep. Bennie Thompson of Mississippi has confirmed the January 6 House select committee (which Thompson chairs) will hold its next and possibly final hearing. The details remain unclear other than it won't be held during primetime.

title: Russian teenager banned from tennis for nine months following anti-doping breach
description: A 14-year-old Russian tennis player has been banned from the sport for nine months following an anti-doping breach, the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) has said in a statement on Friday.

title: Western countries slam Russian-backed 'sham' referendums in Ukraine
Western countries slam Russian-backed 'sham' referendums in Ukraine
description:
• Russians flee Putin's 'partial mobilization'
• See Russian men being bussed away

title: Annemiek van Vleuten wins women's road race gold at World Championships with a fractured elbow
description: In a race made chaotic by the rain, Dutchwoman Annemiek van Vleuten rode to glory in a thrilling women's road race at the Road World Championships in Australia on Saturday.

title: A giraffe unexpectedly gave birth right in front of zoo visitors
description: Visitors at the Virginia Zoo had the experience of a lifetime after a giraffe unexpectedly gave birth in front of them.

title: Nadal on Federer's retirement: 'An important part of my life is leaving too'
description: When the end came neither Roger Federer or Rafael Nadal could hold back the tears.

title: Spotted lanternflies are thriving in US Northeast. Scientists fear they could spread farther
description: Spotted lanternflies are thriving in the Northeast this summer. In New York City, where this year's invasion seems particularly extreme, people squash them on the streets, on railings and even on their restaurant tables. The exterior walls of Big Apple buildings are blanketed with speckled, red bugs.

title: Storm on track to be an 'extreme weather event' in Canada, threatening about two months' worth of rainfall
description: Hurricane Fiona, now referred to as a post-tropical cyclone, has made landfall in Nova Scotia, racing through Canada's Atlantic seaboard early Saturday in what could be a "landmark" weather event for the country.

title: This iconic bar of soap has stuck around for nearly 150 years
description: Walk into a Walmart, Target, any drugstore chain in your neighborhood or a corner bodega for New York City dwellers, and chances are you'll find an Ivory Soap bar, or a pack of 10 bars for under $5, sitting on the shelf.

title: Atlanta wants to build a huge police training facility in a forest. Some are fighting to stop it
description: When Ram moved to the Boulder Walk neighborhood just southeast of Atlanta five years ago, it felt like finding a hidden gem: It was a diverse, affordable and family-friendly community just steps away from the local high school, bordering a forest but still a short drive from the big city; perfect for her family of five.

title: 'Baby' island appears in Pacific Ocean after underwater volcano erupts
description: The Central Tonga Islands welcomed the birth of a new baby -- a baby island, that is.

title: The airports that travelers dread
description: Happy new season! Depending on your hemisphere, the autumn or spring equinox has just passed (here's the science on that), but if you're not digging the pumpkin spice or cool nights, there's always the option to jet across the globe.

title: Iran restricts internet as Mahsa Amini protest deaths mount and UN calls for investigation
description: Iranian authorities say they will restrict internet access in the country until calm is restored to the streets, as protests over the death of a young woman in the custody of the morality police rock the Islamic Republic.

title: The conditions are perfect for a populist resurgence in Europe
description: On Sunday night, it is widely expected that Giorgia Meloni will become Italy's first female prime minister.

title: Signs of torture, mutilation on bodies at Izium mass burial site: Ukraine officials
description: Ukrainian officials say they have finished exhuming bodies from a mass burial site in Izium -- and that of the 436 bodies found, 30 showed signs of torture.

title: Florida governor said America was first place to think slavery was wrong. See Van Jones react
description: CNN's Van Jones reacts to Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis saying no one questioned slavery until the American Revolution during an event discussing his "Stop Woke Act" which prohibits race-based conversation in schools and businesses.

title: In pictures: Tennis great Roger Federer
description: Roger Federer, one of the greatest tennis players in history, is calling it a career.

title: See Russian men bussed away to fight in Putin's war
description: Russian men are being conscripted as a part of Putin's "partial mobilization" to fight in Ukraine. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: 'My beliefs haven't changed': From social housing to skyscrapers, architect Moshe Safdie is still an idealist
description: There are few buildings that have more drastically shaped a city's image than Marina Bay Sands. Just as the Eiffel Tower and Burj Khalifa define the skylines of Paris and Dubai, the soaring three-tower resort, joined across the top by a horizontal "skypark" and the world's most famous infinity pool, is an icon both in and of Singapore.
